column5: Every year my daughter competes in the YBC 4 Step to Stardom in a 4 player team or single for the nationals at the provincial tournament and every year she comes close (second or third place) but not enough to make it, but yesterday was another story    The team played great and took the gold for the win  I had good vibes about the team synergy and their performance from previous tournament games leading to the provincial finals and I couldn't be any prouder of them for their quest and commitment they showed.  After the first game, they had a deficit of 43 pins behind the lead but in their next 3, took over the lead (they had 100+ plus pins after the third) and did not look back  Me, my wife and the other parents were their cheering fans and let me tell you, my ears are still buzzing from all the noise.  We put in a 12 hour shift but it was all worth it It took Mélissa 7 years to achieve her goal and now is going out West in Saskatchewan to compete against the other province best team  The medal ceremony was quite emotional for me and felt real good seeing them on the middle step of the podium    Proudest dad in the universe if you ask me  Here are Québec's gold medalist and representative at the Nationals in Saskatchewan     My daughter is the one on the far right   Love you my little princess  "insert hugs and kisses emotion here"    Hope you enjoy Leechman
Well done always nice to have a champion around the house!!!
Thanks lookinforwalleye!!! Not only can she out fish me but can out bowl me too
My wife is the bowler in the family a few years ago her team won a big tourny and they won a week in the DR and luggage!! Unfortunately they closed the bowling alley in Orangeville!!!
Congrats, Jacques!!  I can hear the pride in your words
Jacques The smile on your face must be as big as mine Cingrats to your daughter If it makes you feel better  I get out fished as well, most of the time KIDS!!!!

That is frolicking awesome congrats to the team. My daughter also tried out for this event but fell short this year  she sure does try hard and made it to the Provencals once for high low doubles but they fell short I was so crushed for her. I hope they have a blast in SK Good luck to them.

Right on    Too bad about the closing... such a great sport to play   Thanks Frankie!!!  I'm on cloud nine right now   Thanks Vince!!!  Yeah kids.... she's got nerves of steel   Thanks Mike!!!  I know the feeling too well... every year I had to look at my daughter's face after a defeat and I was crushed too   this year is a whole different story    tell your daughter to keep at it and practice, practice... Melissa's been practicing a couple times a week for this event and now that she's going to the Nationals, I think it might be 3 times a week
As a former YBC bowler, congrats to all!! You are obviously one very proud dad.  :thumbsup_anim:
Thanks fishnsled!!!  I sure am   Mélissa is 15 and has an average of 196.  Yesterday she played 2 games above her average out of 4.... solid playing if you ask me
congrats to you and melissa thats cool your one happy dad thats what its all about
Congrats to her and the team. 5 or 10 pin. I bowled YBC 5 pin out of Midland Ont and enjoyed my experiences.
Thanks Corvy!!!  It sure is   Thanks Bob D!!!  It's 5 pin.  I'm sure you did
Congrats!! Thats awesome!!
Thanks TJ!!!

Great to here congrats to every body & thanx for posting the Picture, so now if I go bowling & see any of them there I'll know to just turn around & leave, so as to not embarrass myself when I pull the bumpers up so the ball at least takes the corner pin's out SBK
Thanks Richard!!!  lol
Probly takes after her mothers side of the family.  Congrats
Thanks B!!!
Sheesh............dont know how i missed this.Its been so quiet in here You sound like a really proud PaPa, Jacques!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!Give her a hug and congrats from me
I sure am    Thanks Paul!!!  I most definitely will let her know

Tell them good job, my 2 daughters were always at it for the Ontario Provincials but small towns could never beat out the big city teams. Its a hard go and I to know about the 2 or 3 days of ear buzzing that goes on after

Thanks ovaldale3!!!  I will    Over here it seemed to same for some players / teams, always the same individuals to win....  but now that our team won, it's a great change  I hear that at the Nationals, the noise level is even louder than the Provincials  Oh and welcome to OFC
